title: Authors and Citation
text: Li W (2023). autovi: Auto visual inference computer vision models. https://tengmcing.github.io/autovi/, https://github.com/TengMCing/autovi/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {autovi: Auto visual inference with computer vision models},   author = {Weihao Li},   year = {2023},   note = {https://tengmcing.github.io/autovi/, https://github.com/TengMCing/autovi/}, }

what: Auto visual inference with computer vision models
title: Auto visual inference with computer vision models
text: goal autovi provide tools conducting auto visual inference.

title: Auto visual inference with computer vision models
text: can install development version autovi like :

title: Auto visual inference with computer vision models
code: library(tidyverse) keras_mod <- keras::load_model_tf(here::here("temp_model/32")) dgp_mod <- visage::poly_model(x = visage::rand_uniform(-1, 1), sigma = 1)  this_dat <- dgp_mod$gen(300) this_mod <- dgp_mod$fit(this_dat)  my_vi <- autovi::auto_vi(fitted_mod = this_mod,                          keras_mod = keras_mod,                          node_index = 1L)  my_vi$check(boot_draws = 100L, null_draws = 100L) my_vi #>  #> ── <AUTO_VI object> #> Status: #>  - Fitted model: lm #>  - Keras model: (None, 32, 32, 3) -> (None, 1) #>     - Output node index: 1 #>  - Result: #>     - Observed visual signal strength: 4.398 (p-value = 0) #>     - Null visual signal strength: [100 draws] #>        - Mean: 0.09791 #>        - Quantiles:  #>           ╔═════════════════════════════════════════════════╗ #>           ║   25%    50%    75%    80%    90%    95%    99% ║ #>           ║0.0000 0.0000 0.0000 0.0000 0.1729 0.6822 1.7068 ║ #>           ╚═════════════════════════════════════════════════╝ #>     - Bootstrapped visual signal strength: [100 draws] #>        - Mean: 4.099 (p-value = 0) #>        - Quantiles:  #>           ╔══════════════════════════════════════════╗ #>           ║  25%   50%   75%   80%   90%   95%   99% ║ #>           ║3.951 4.123 4.249 4.284 4.412 4.452 4.594 ║ #>           ╚══════════════════════════════════════════╝ #>     - Likelihood ratio: 0.8637 (boot) / 0 (null) = Inf my_vi$summary_plot()

title: Initialization method — AUTO_VI$..init..
text: function called instance built. User input stored environment. response variable model y.

title: Initialization method — AUTO_VI$..init..
text: fitted_mod Model. model object, e.g. lm. keras_mod Keras model. trained computer vision model. Default NULL. dat Data frame. data used fit model. Default NULL. node_index Integer. index indicating node output layer contains visual signal strength. particularly useful keras model one output nodes. Default 1L.

title: Initialization method — AUTO_VI$..init..
text: Return object .

title: Initialization method — AUTO_VI$..init..
code: my_vi <- auto_vi(fitted_mod = lm(speed ~ dist, data = cars)) my_vi #>  #> ── <AUTO_VI object> #> Status: #>  - Fitted model: lm #>  - Keras model: UNKNOWN #>     - Output node index: 1 #>  - Result: UNKNOWN

title: String representation of the object — AUTO_VI$..str..
code:
AUTO_VI$..str..() #> [1] "<AUTO_VI class>"  my_vi <- auto_vi(fitted_mod = lm(speed ~ dist, data = cars)) my_vi$..str..() #> [1] "<AUTO_VI object>
 Status:
  - Fitted model: lm
  - Keras model: UNKNOWN
     - Output node index: 1
  - Result: UNKNOWN"

what: Predict visual signal strength for bootstrapped residual plots — AUTO_VI$boot_vss
title: Predict visual signal strength for bootstrapped residual plots — AUTO_VI$boot_vss
text: function bootstrap data refits model, predicts visual signal strength bootstrapped residual plots.

title: Predict visual signal strength for bootstrapped residual plots — AUTO_VI$boot_vss
text: draws Integer. Number simulation draws. Default 100L. fitted_mod Model. model object, e.g. lm. Default self$fitted_mod. keras_mod Keras model. trained computer vision model. Default self$keras_mod. dat Data frame. data used fit model. Default self$get_dat(). node_index Integer. index indicating node output layer contains visual signal strength. particularly useful keras model one output nodes. Default 1L. keep_boot_dat Boolean. Whether keep bootstrapped data. Default FALSE. keep_boot_plot Boolean. Whether keep bootstrapped plots. Default FALSE.

title: Predict visual signal strength for bootstrapped residual plots — AUTO_VI$boot_vss
text: tibble 1 3 columns depending argument keep_boot_dat keep_boot_plot.

what: Conduct a auto visual inference check with a computer vision model — AUTO_VI$check
title: Conduct a auto visual inference check with a computer vision model — AUTO_VI$check
text: function conducts visual inference check computer vision model.

title: Conduct a auto visual inference check with a computer vision model — AUTO_VI$check
text: null_draws Integer. Number simulation draws AUTO_VI$null_vss. Default 100L. boot_draws Integer. Number simulation draws AUTO_VI$boot_vss. Default 100L. fitted_mod Model. model object, e.g. lm. Default self$fitted_mod. keras_mod Keras model. trained computer vision model. Default self$keras_mod. method Function. method simulate residuals null hypothesis distribution. lm, recommended method residual rotation AUTO_VI$rotate_resid. Default self$rotate_resid. dat Data frame. data used fit model. Default self$get_dat(). node_index Integer. index indicating node output layer contains visual signal strength. particularly useful keras model one output nodes. Default 1L. keep_dat Boolean. Whether keep simulated data. Default FALSE. keep_plot Boolean. Whether keep simulated plots. Default FALSE.

title: Conduct a auto visual inference check with a computer vision model — AUTO_VI$check
text: Return object .

title: List of diagnostic results — AUTO_VI$check_result
text: list, initialized method AUTO_VI$check run.

what: Compute the likelihood ratio using the simulated result — AUTO_VI$lr_ratio
title: Compute the likelihood ratio using the simulated result — AUTO_VI$lr_ratio
text: function estimates likelihood observing visual signal strength terms bootstrapped distribution simulated null distribution, computes ratio two likelihood.

title: Compute the likelihood ratio using the simulated result — AUTO_VI$lr_ratio
text: named vector three elements boot, null ratio.

what: Simulate null plots and predict the visual signal strength — AUTO_VI$null_vss
title: Simulate null plots and predict the visual signal strength — AUTO_VI$null_vss
text: function simulates null plots null hypothesis distribution, predicts visual signal strength.

title: Simulate null plots and predict the visual signal strength — AUTO_VI$null_vss
text: draws Integer. Number simulation draws. Default 100L. fitted_mod Model. model object, e.g. lm. Default self$fitted_mod. keras_mod Keras model. trained computer vision model. Default self$keras_mod. method Function. method simulate residuals null hypothesis distribution. lm, recommended method residual rotation AUTO_VI$rotate_resid. Default self$rotate_resid. node_index Integer. index indicating node output layer contains visual signal strength. particularly useful keras model one output nodes. Default 1L. keep_null_dat Boolean. Whether keep simulated null data. Default FALSE. keep_null_plot Boolean. Whether keep simulated null plots. Default FALSE.

title: Simulate null plots and predict the visual signal strength — AUTO_VI$null_vss
text: tibble 1 3 columns depending argument keep_null_dat keep_null_plot.

what: Draw a standard residual plot — AUTO_VI$plot_resid
title: Draw a standard residual plot — AUTO_VI$plot_resid
text: function draws standard residual plot.

title: Draw a standard residual plot — AUTO_VI$plot_resid
text: x Data frame. data frame containing variables .resid .fitted. Default self$get_fitted_and_resid(). theme ggtheme. ggplot theme object. Default ggplot2::theme_light(base_size = 11/5). alpha Numeric. Alpha dot. Value 0 1. Default 1. size Numeric. Size dot. Value 0 1. Default 0.5. stroke Numeric. Stroke dot. Value 0 1. Default 0.5. remove_axis Boolean. Whether remove axis. Default TRUE. remove_legend Boolean. Whether remove legend. Default TRUE. remove_grid_line Boolean. Whether remove grid lines. Default TRUE. add_zero_line Boolean. Whether add zero horizontal line. Default TRUE.

title: Draw a standard residual plot — AUTO_VI$plot_resid
text: ggplot.

title: Draw a standard residual plot — AUTO_VI$plot_resid
code: my_vi <- auto_vi(fitted_mod = lm(speed ~ dist, data = cars)) my_vi$plot_resid()

title: Remove a plot — AUTO_VI$remove_plot
text: function removes plot.

title: Remove a plot — AUTO_VI$remove_plot
text: path Character. Path image file. check_ext Boolean. Whether check file extension.

title: Remove a plot — AUTO_VI$remove_plot
text: Return object .

title: Remove a plot — AUTO_VI$remove_plot
code: my_vi <- auto_vi(fitted_mod = lm(speed ~ dist, data = cars)) temp_path <- my_vi$save_plot(my_vi$plot_resid()) my_vi$remove_plot(temp_path) file.exists(temp_path) #> [1] FALSE

what: Get rotated residuals from a fitted linear model — AUTO_VI$rotate_resid
title: Get rotated residuals from a fitted linear model — AUTO_VI$rotate_resid
text: function gets rotated residuals fitted linear model. rotated residuals generated first regressing random noises original regressors, multiply obtained residuals original RSS divided current RSS. results rotated residuals.

title: Get rotated residuals from a fitted linear model — AUTO_VI$rotate_resid
text: fitted_mod lm. linear model object. Default self$fitted_mod.

title: Get rotated residuals from a fitted linear model — AUTO_VI$rotate_resid
text: tibble two columns .fitted .resid.

title: Get rotated residuals from a fitted linear model — AUTO_VI$rotate_resid
code: my_vi <- auto_vi(fitted_mod = lm(speed ~ dist, data = cars)) rotated_resid <- my_vi$rotate_resid() my_vi$plot_resid(rotated_resid)

title: Save a plot — AUTO_VI$save_plot
text: function saves plot ggplot2::ggsave.

title: Save a plot — AUTO_VI$save_plot
text: p ggplot. plot. path Character. Path save. Default tempfile(fileext = '.png'). width Numeric. Width plot. Default 7/5. height Numeric. Height plot. Default 7/4. ... Arguments passed ggplot2::ggsave.

title: Save a plot — AUTO_VI$save_plot
text: string indicating path file.

title: Save a plot — AUTO_VI$save_plot
code: my_vi <- auto_vi(fitted_mod = lm(speed ~ dist, data = cars)) my_vi$save_plot(my_vi$plot_resid()) #> [1] "/var/folders/61/bv7_1qzs20x6fjb2rsv7513r0000gn/T//RtmplPwz56/filecc8e57727759.png"
